The algorithm then recursively sorts the sublists and swaps any elements that are in the wrong part of the list.

To write a quick sort in Python, you can use the following code:
```
def quick_sort(arr):
    if len(arr) <= 1:
        return arr
    pivot = arr[0]
    less = [x for x in arr if x < pivot]
    greater = [x for x in arr if x > pivot]
    return quick_sort(less) + [pivot] + quick_sort(greater)
```
